metadata.title: Regulation D Compliance Control Catalog
metadata.remarks: Complete control catalog for SEC Regulation D private placement exemptions. Controls map to 17 CFR 230.500-508. Verified against eCFR API. DISCLAIMER: Control statements are illustrative interpretations of regulatory requirements, not legal advice. Each control mapping requires case-by-case legal review before reliance. Verify against current eCFR and consult securities counsel.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Regulation D relates to transactions exempted from the registration requirements of section 5 of the Securities Act of 1933. Such transactions are NOT exempt from the antifraud, civil liability, or other provisions of the federal securities laws. Issuers must provide such further material information as may be necessary to make required disclosures not misleading.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Compliance attestation confirming antifraud obligations are understood and met

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Antifraud policy documentation and investor disclosure materials

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Legal review confirming all material information has been disclosed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Nothing in Regulation D obviates the need to comply with any applicable state law relating to the offer and sale of securities. Special attention should be directed to state laws regarding registration of persons who receive remuneration, disqualification of issuers based on state orders, and requirements for filings of notices of sales.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Blue sky filing receipts for each state where securities are offered or sold

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: State notice filing confirmations

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Broker/agent registration records for persons receiving remuneration in connection with the offering

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: State-by-state compliance checklist documenting applicable requirements

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Attempted compliance with any rule in Regulation D does not act as an exclusive election; the issuer can also claim the availability of any other applicable exemption. Failure to satisfy Rule 506(b) shall not raise any presumption that section 4(a)(2) is unavailable.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Exemption election documentation identifying which exemption(s) are being relied upon

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Legal analysis memo identifying alternative exemptions available if primary exemption fails

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Regulation D is available only to the issuer of the securities and not to any affiliate of that issuer or to any other person for resales of the issuer's securities. The exemption applies to specific transactions, not the securities themselves.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Issuer certification confirming it is the entity offering/selling securities

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Affiliate analysis documenting no affiliate is conducting resales under the exemption

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: No-resale confirmation from all purchasers

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Regulation D may be used for business combinations that involve sales by virtue of Rule 145(a) or otherwise.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Rule 145 analysis documenting whether the transaction qualifies

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Transaction structure documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Regulation D is not available to any issuer for any transaction or chain of transactions that, although in technical compliance with Regulation D, is part of a plan or scheme to evade the registration provisions of the Act. In such cases, registration under the Act is required.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Offering structure review documenting legitimate business purpose

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Legal opinion confirming offering is not structured to evade registration

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Business purpose memorandum

controls.title: Offshore Offerings and Regulation S Coordination

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Securities offered and sold outside the United States in accordance with Regulation S need not be registered under the Act. Regulation S may be relied on even if coincident offers are made under Regulation D inside the United States. Offshore purchasers and proceeds are excluded from Regulation D calculations unless the issuer elects solely Regulation D coverage.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Regulation S compliance documentation for offshore sales

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Purchaser location records demonstrating offshore status

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Election documentation if issuer relies solely on Regulation D for offshore sales

groups.title: Definitions and Terms Used in Regulation D

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The organization shall verify that each investor qualifies as an accredited investor under one or more of the 13 categories defined in 17 CFR 230.501(a), or that the issuer reasonably believes the investor comes within such categories, at the time of the sale of the securities.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Verification must be performed using reasonable steps as defined in 17 CFR 230.506(c)(2)(ii) for 506(c) offerings. Documentation of verification method and results must be retained.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Investor accreditation questionnaire or self-certification form

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Third-party verification letter (attorney, CPA, broker-dealer, or investment adviser)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Supporting documentation (tax returns, W-2s, bank statements, brokerage statements) if self-verified

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Verification procedure documentation showing reasonable steps taken

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any bank, savings and loan association, broker-dealer, registered investment adviser, insurance company, registered investment company, business development company, SBIC, RBIC, state employee plan with >$5M assets, or ERISA employee benefit plan (with fiduciary decision-maker that is a bank/S&L/insurance co/registered adviser, or with >$5M total assets, or self-directed by accredited investors).

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Charter, license, or registration documentation confirming institutional status

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: FINRA BrokerCheck or SEC IARD registration confirmation (for broker-dealers and investment advisers)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: ERISA plan documents with asset verification >$5M or fiduciary qualification documentation

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: SBA license documentation (for SBICs)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any private business development company as defined in section 202(a)(22) of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: SEC filing or registration confirming BDC status under Investment Advisers Act

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Entity organizational documents demonstrating compliance with section 202(a)(22)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any organization described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, corporation, Massachusetts or similar business trust, partnership, or limited liability company, not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring the securities offered, with total assets in excess of $5,000,000.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Audited or unaudited financial statements showing total assets >$5,000,000

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Organizational documents (to verify formation date and purpose was NOT specific acquisition of these securities)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Entity certification/representation letter

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any director, executive officer, or general partner of the issuer of the securities being offered or sold, or any director, executive officer, or general partner of a general partner of that issuer.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Board resolution or officer list confirming director/executive officer/GP status

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Corporate records (bylaws, operating agreement, partnership agreement) confirming role

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written representation of current status at time of sale

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any natural person whose individual net worth, or joint net worth with that person's spouse or spousal equivalent, exceeds $1,000,000, EXCLUDING the value of primary residence and applying debt calculation rules per 230.501(a)(5)(i).

parts.name: rule
parts.prose: Primary residence shall NOT be included as an asset

parts.name: rule
parts.prose: Mortgage debt up to fair market value of primary residence shall NOT be included as a liability, EXCEPT debt incurred within 60 days before sale (unless for acquisition)

parts.name: rule
parts.prose: Mortgage debt EXCEEDING fair market value of primary residence SHALL be included as a liability

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Bank/brokerage statements, appraisals, tax assessments, credit reports dated within 3 months

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written confirmation from registered broker-dealer, SEC-registered investment adviser, licensed attorney, or CPA

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Primary residence exclusion calculation worksheet with supporting documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any natural person who had an individual income in excess of $200,000 in each of the two most recent years or joint income with that person's spouse or spousal equivalent in excess of $300,000 in each of those years and has a reasonable expectation of reaching the same income level in the current year.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: IRS forms (W-2, 1099, K-1, 1040) for two most recent years

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written confirmation from registered broker-dealer, SEC-registered investment adviser, licensed attorney, or CPA

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written representation of reasonable expectation of reaching same income level in current year

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any trust, with total assets in excess of $5,000,000, not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring the securities offered, whose purchase is directed by a sophisticated person as described in 230.506(b)(2)(ii).

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Trust agreement or trust instrument

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Financial statements or account statements showing total assets >$5,000,000

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Sophistication documentation for the person directing the purchase per 230.506(b)(2)(ii)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Certification that trust was NOT formed for the specific purpose of acquiring these securities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any entity in which all of the equity owners are accredited investors. Look-through to natural persons is permissible to determine accredited investor status.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Entity organizational documents identifying all equity owners

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Accredited investor verification for EACH equity owner (look-through documentation)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Entity certification that ownership has not changed since verification

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any entity, of a type not listed in paragraph (a)(1), (2), (3), (7), or (8), not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring the securities offered, owning investments in excess of $5,000,000. 'Investments' as defined in Rule 2a51-1(b) under the Investment Company Act of 1940.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Investment portfolio documentation per Rule 2a51-1(b) showing investments >$5,000,000

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Entity organizational documents confirming entity type is not listed in (a)(1),(2),(3),(7),(8)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Certification entity was NOT formed for the specific purpose of acquiring these securities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any natural person holding in good standing one or more professional certifications, designations, or credentials from an accredited educational institution that the Commission has designated as qualifying for accredited investor status. Currently designated: Series 7, Series 65, Series 82.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: FINRA BrokerCheck verification of certification/license

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: State securities regulator verification

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Good-standing confirmation from certification body or self-regulatory organization

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any natural person who is a 'knowledgeable employee' as defined in Rule 3c-5(a)(4) under the Investment Company Act of 1940, of the issuer where the issuer would be an investment company but for the exclusion under section 3(c)(1) or 3(c)(7) of that act.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Employment verification confirming current employment with the issuer

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Issuer confirmation that it would be an investment company but for section 3(c)(1) or 3(c)(7) exclusion

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Rule 3c-5(a)(4) qualification documentation demonstrating knowledgeable employee status

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any 'family office' as defined in Rule 202(a)(11)(G)-1 under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 with: (i) assets under management >$5,000,000, (ii) not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring the securities offered, and (iii) prospective investment directed by a person with knowledge and experience to evaluate merits and risks.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Rule 202(a)(11)(G)-1 qualification documentation demonstrating family office status

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: AUM documentation showing assets under management >$5,000,000

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Sophistication documentation for the person directing the investment

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Certification entity was NOT formed for specific purpose of acquiring these securities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Any 'family client' as defined in Rule 202(a)(11)(G)-1 under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, of a family office meeting the requirements in paragraph (a)(12), whose prospective investment is directed by such family office.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Family office qualification documentation per 501(a)(12) requirements

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Family client status documentation under Rule 202(a)(11)(G)-1

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written confirmation that investment is directed by the qualifying family office

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: An affiliate of, or person affiliated with, a specified person shall mean a person that directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls or is controlled by, or is under common control with, the person specified.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Affiliate analysis documenting all control relationships

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Organizational chart showing direct and indirect intermediary relationships

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Aggregate offering price shall mean the sum of all cash, services, property, notes, cancellation of debt, or other consideration to be received by an issuer for issuance of its securities. Non-cash consideration must be valued by bona fide sales or fair value. Foreign currency must be translated at the exchange rate at time of sale.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Offering price calculation worksheet documenting all forms of consideration

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Non-cash consideration valuation documentation (bona fide sales or fair value determination)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Foreign currency exchange rate documentation (if applicable)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Business combination shall mean any transaction of the type specified in paragraph (a) of Rule 145 under the Act and any acquisition by one issuer, in exchange for its own or parent's stock, of stock of another issuer resulting in control.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Rule 145 analysis documentation

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Control determination documentation post-acquisition

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: For Rule 506(b) offerings with non-accredited investors, the organization shall maintain a count of purchasers applying the exclusion and counting rules in 17 CFR 230.501(e), ensuring no more than 35 non-accredited purchasers.

parts.name: exclusion
parts.prose: EXCLUDE: Relatives/spouse/spousal equivalent with same primary residence

parts.name: exclusion
parts.prose: EXCLUDE: Trusts/estates where purchaser + family >50% beneficial interest

parts.name: exclusion
parts.prose: EXCLUDE: Entities where purchaser + family >50% equity

parts.name: exclusion
parts.prose: EXCLUDE: All accredited investors

parts.name: counting
parts.prose: COUNT: Entity formed for specific purpose of acquiring securities = count each beneficial owner separately

parts.name: counting
parts.prose: COUNT: Non-contributory ERISA employee benefit plan = one purchaser where trustee makes all investment decisions

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Purchaser tracking log with running count of non-accredited purchasers

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Exclusion documentation for each excluded purchaser (relationship, beneficial interest)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Entity look-through analysis for entities formed to acquire securities

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Executive officer shall mean the president, any vice president in charge of a principal business unit/division/function, any officer who performs a policy making function, or any person who performs similar policy making functions for the issuer.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Officer determination memo identifying all executive officers

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Organizational chart identifying policy-making roles

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A purchaser representative must satisfy: (1) independence from the issuer (not affiliate/director/officer/10%+ owner, with exceptions), (2) knowledge and experience to evaluate investment merits and risks, (3) written acknowledgment by purchaser, (4) written disclosure of material relationships with issuer. Each acknowledgment must reference the specific investment  blanket acknowledgments are insufficient.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Independence verification documenting representative is not an affiliate, director, officer, or 10%+ owner

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Sophistication documentation for the representative (knowledge and experience)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written acknowledgment by purchaser for this specific investment

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written disclosure of all material relationships between representative/affiliates and issuer/affiliates

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Spousal equivalent shall mean a cohabitant occupying a relationship generally equivalent to that of a spouse.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Relationship attestation from investor and spousal equivalent (if relying on joint calculations)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: To determine whether offers and sales should be integrated, see Rule 152 (17 CFR 230.152). Offerings that are part of the same plan of financing may be integrated.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Rule 152 integration analysis documentation

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Offering timeline showing separation between offerings

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: If the issuer sells securities under Rule 506(b) to any purchaser that is not an accredited investor, the issuer shall furnish specified information a reasonable time prior to sale. Not required for Rule 504 offerings or sales to accredited investors. Non-reporting issuers must provide Regulation A-equivalent disclosures and GAAP/IFRS financial statements. Reporting issuers must provide annual reports, 10-K, and recent SEC filings.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Disclosure package provided to non-accredited purchasers

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Financial statements prepared under GAAP or IFRS

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written record of Q&A opportunity provided to purchasers per 502(b)(2)(v)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Delivery confirmation with dates showing information furnished a reasonable time prior to sale

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Description of material information provided to accredited investors but not yet delivered to non-accredited purchasers per 502(b)(2)(iv)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Except as provided in Rule 504(b)(1) or Rule 506(c), neither the issuer nor any person acting on its behalf shall offer or sell securities by any form of general solicitation or general advertising, including advertisements, articles, notices published in any media, broadcasts, or seminars/meetings whose attendees were invited by general solicitation.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Marketing materials log documenting all materials used in the offering

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Advertising audit records confirming no general solicitation (for 506(b))

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Pre-existing relationship documentation for each investor contacted (for 506(b))

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Organization shall not use advertisements, articles, public seminars, mass mailings, or any form of general solicitation to market securities in a 506(b) offering.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Pre-existing substantive relationship documentation for each investor

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Advertising/media monitoring records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: If using general solicitation under 506(c), organization SHALL take reasonable steps to verify accredited investor status per 230.506(c)(2)(ii) and SHALL NOT sell to any non-accredited investors.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Verification method documentation for each purchaser (income: IRS forms; net worth: statements + credit report; third-party confirmation; prior certification; or written representation)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Solicitation/advertising materials used in offering

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Securities acquired under Regulation D have section 4(a)(2) status and cannot be resold without registration or an exemption. The issuer shall exercise reasonable care to assure purchasers are not underwriters, through: (1) inquiry into acquisition purpose, (2) written disclosure of unregistered status, (3) restrictive legend on certificates.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Subscription agreement containing investment intent representations and restrictive legend

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Written disclosure to each purchaser that securities are unregistered and cannot be resold without registration or exemption

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Transfer restriction procedures documentation (legend placement, transfer agent instructions)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: An issuer relying on Rule 504 or Rule 506 must file Form D with the Commission no later than 15 calendar days after the first sale of securities. Amendments must be filed to correct material errors, reflect changes in information, and annually if the offering continues.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Filed Form D confirmation from EDGAR

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Documentation of first sale date establishing the 15-day filing deadline

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Amendment filings documenting material changes

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Annual amendment filing confirmation (if offering continues past first anniversary)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Form D must be filed electronically via EDGAR in accordance with Regulation S-T. Every notice must be signed by a person duly authorized by the issuer.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: EDGAR filing confirmation with accession number

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Authorized signatory documentation (board resolution or power of attorney)

groups.title: Exemption for Limited Offerings Not Exceeding $10,000,000

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Offers and sales satisfying 504(b) conditions by an issuer that is NOT: (1) subject to Exchange Act reporting requirements, (2) an investment company, or (3) a development stage company with no specific business plan or planning mergers with unidentified entities, shall be exempt under section 3(b) of the Act.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Issuer eligibility determination documenting non-reporting status

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Investment company analysis confirming issuer is not an investment company

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Business plan documentation (for development stage companies)

controls.title: Rule 504 General Conditions and Offering Limit

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Offers and sales must satisfy Rules 501 and 502(a), (c), and (d), except 502(c)/(d) do not apply for: (i) state-registered offerings with public filing and disclosure, (ii) multi-state with at least one qualifying state registration, or (iii) state exemptions permitting solicitation to accredited investors only. Aggregate offering price shall not exceed $10,000,000 less amounts sold in prior 12 months under Rule 504 or in violation of section 5(a).

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: State registration filings and substantive disclosure documents (if relying on state registration pathway)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: $10,000,000 aggregate offering price calculation worksheet

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: 12-month lookback documentation of all prior Rule 504 sales and any section 5(a) violations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: No exemption under Rule 504 shall be available if the issuer would be subject to disqualification under Rule 506(d) on or after January 20, 2017. Disclosure of prior bad actor events occurring before January 20, 2017 is required per Rule 506(e).

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Bad actor check per Rule 506(d) procedures for all covered persons

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Pre-January 20, 2017 event disclosure to purchasers (if applicable)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Rule 505 was repealed effective May 22, 2017 (81 FR 83553, Nov. 21, 2016). Its provisions were integrated into the amended Rule 504. Offerings previously relying on Rule 505 should transition to Rule 504 or Rule 506.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Historical offering records documenting any pre-2017 reliance on Rule 505

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Transition documentation showing migration to Rule 504 or Rule 506 for ongoing offerings

groups.title: Exemption for Limited Offers and Sales Without Regard to Dollar Amount

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Offers and sales satisfying conditions in paragraph (b) or (c) shall be deemed transactions not involving any public offering within the meaning of section 4(a)(2) of the Act.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Section 4(a)(2) analysis documentation

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Exemption determination memo identifying reliance on 506(b) or 506(c)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Offerings subject to limitation on manner of offering must satisfy Rules 501 and 502. No more than 35 non-accredited purchasers in any 90-calendar-day period. Each non-accredited purchaser must have such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters that they are capable of evaluating the merits and risks of the investment.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Solicitation compliance records confirming no general solicitation or advertising

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Purchaser count verification showing no more than 35 non-accredited purchasers per 90-day period

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Sophistication evaluation documentation for each non-accredited purchaser per 506(b)(2)(ii)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Offerings not subject to limitation on manner of offering must satisfy Rules 501 and 502(a) and (d). ALL purchasers must be accredited investors. Issuer must take reasonable steps to verify accredited status using non-exclusive methods: (A) income verification via IRS forms, (B) net worth verification via statements and credit reports, (C) third-party written confirmation, (D) prior 506(b) investor certification, (E) written representation from previously verified investor (valid 5 years).

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Verification method records for EACH purchaser documenting which method was used

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: IRS forms (W-2, 1099, K-1, 1040) for income-based verification per 506(c)(2)(ii)(A)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Bank/brokerage statements and consumer credit report for net-worth-based verification per 506(c)(2)(ii)(B)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Third-party written confirmation from broker-dealer, investment adviser, attorney, or CPA per 506(c)(2)(ii)(C)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Advertising and solicitation materials used in the offering

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Before relying on Rule 506, organization shall conduct factual inquiry to determine if any covered person is subject to disqualifying events under 230.506(d)(1), including: (i) felony/misdemeanor convictions, (ii) court injunctions, (iii) final orders from regulators, (iv) SEC suspension/revocation orders, (v) SEC cease-and-desist orders, (vi) SRO suspension/expulsion, (vii) refusal/stop orders on registration statements, (viii) USPS false representation orders.

parts.name: covered-persons
parts.prose: Covered persons include: the issuer; any predecessor or affiliated issuer; directors/officers/GPs/managing members; 20%+ beneficial owners (by voting power); promoters; investment managers (for pooled funds); compensated solicitors; and directors/officers/GPs of any such investment manager or solicitor.

parts.name: exceptions
parts.prose: Exceptions: (i) events before September 23, 2013; (ii) Commission good-cause waiver; (iii) court/regulatory authority written advisory against disqualification; (iv) issuer did not know and could not have known with reasonable care.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Background check reports for all covered persons

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: SEC EDGAR search for prior enforcement actions

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: FINRA BrokerCheck for securities industry covered persons

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Completed questionnaire responses from each covered person addressing all 8 disqualifying event categories

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Legal opinion or certification of no disqualifying events

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The issuer shall furnish to each purchaser, a reasonable time prior to sale, a description in writing of any matters that would have triggered disqualification under 506(d)(1) but occurred before September 23, 2013. Failure to disclose timely does not prevent reliance if issuer establishes reasonable care.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Pre-September 23, 2013 event disclosure document provided to purchasers

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Factual inquiry documentation demonstrating reasonable care in identifying undisclosed events

groups.title: Disqualifying Provision Relating to Exemptions Under Rules 504 and 506

controls.title: Disqualification for Form D Filing Failure

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: No exemption under Rule 504 or Rule 506 shall be available for an issuer if such issuer, any of its predecessors or affiliates have been subject to any order, judgment, or decree of any court of competent jurisdiction temporarily, preliminarily, or permanently enjoining such person for failure to comply with Rule 503.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Form D compliance history for issuer, predecessors, and affiliates

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Court order/injunction search results for issuer, predecessors, and affiliates regarding Rule 503 compliance

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The disqualification under 507(a) shall not apply if the Commission determines, upon a showing of good cause, that it is not necessary under the circumstances that the exemption be denied.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Good cause petition documentation submitted to the Commission (if applicable)

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Commission determination letter granting waiver (if applicable)

groups.title: Insignificant Deviations from a Term, Condition or Requirement of Regulation D

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A failure to comply with a term, condition, or requirement of Rule 504 or Rule 506 will not result in loss of exemption for any particular offer or sale if: (1) the failure did not pertain to a term directly intended to protect that individual, (2) the failure was insignificant with respect to the offering as a whole (failures of 502(c), 504(b)(2), or 506(b)(2)(i) are DEEMED significant), and (3) a good faith and reasonable attempt was made to comply.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Deviation description documenting the specific term, condition, or requirement that was not met

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Insignificance analysis demonstrating failure was not significant to the offering as a whole

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Good faith compliance documentation showing reasonable attempt was made

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Analysis confirming failure did not pertain to a term protecting the specific individual/entity

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A transaction under Rule 504 or Rule 506 shall comply with all applicable terms, conditions, and requirements. Where an exemption is established only through reliance upon 508(a), the failure to comply shall nonetheless be actionable by the Commission under section 20 of the Act.

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Compliance attestation acknowledging continued SEC enforcement authority under section 20

parts.name: evidence-item
parts.prose: Remediation documentation addressing any identified failures

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Organization shall maintain complete records of investor qualification documentation, verification methods used, and all investor communications for a minimum of 5 years after the offering closes.

parts.name: record-item
parts.prose: Subscription agreements

parts.name: record-item
parts.prose: Accredited investor questionnaires

parts.name: record-item

parts.prose: Purchaser representative acknowledgments (if applicable)

parts.name: evidence-item

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Organization shall retain all versions of offering materials, including PPMs, term sheets, and marketing materials, with version dates and distribution records.
